@xaiver wrote:

no offense bro…but most of them arent so hot. Try not to make teh backgrounds so flashy and try to pick some better renders (real people) cartoon renders are just too hard to blend !

item.title: Sigs I made
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

[quote=“Casey., post:4, topic:117611”]Overall, a 8/10-The fonts could improve.
10/10 on the mudkip one, I’d love one like that <3[/quote]
Aren’t we debating this in another topic? Give a reasonable rating or don’t rate at all. Giving them excellent ratings for pieces of shit is telling them their doing good and they should continue it. You want them to know whats bad so they improve it, not encourage mistakes.

Read full topic

item.title: Sigs I made
item.dc:creator: @exe626 exe626
item.description:
@exe626 wrote:

Things to improve on:
Color choices
-The mixture of some of the colors in your art seem out of place. Somethings just don’t work together, you need to think your color scheme through.
Render/pre-made image
-The position, flow and type of render you use it important. Just don’t slap a render in there and hope it looks good. Don’t make it overly huge or overly small, make it fit and not stick out like a red dot on a piece of white paper.
Text
-This is one of the most important things involving people who want to brand their image. Never make the text draw attention, never make it huge, and never make it loud. The name you put on your piece of work is just to claim it, to let people know who made it. You don’t want them to spend time looking at the text, you want them to look at the picture.

Read full topic
